medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant abdominal pain and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced acute moderately-severe right lower quadrant pain 5 days ago, which went away except for slight discomfort until the night prior to admission, when the pain became much more severe. The pain has remained localized, has not migrated or radiated. Patient reports subjective low-grade fevers and mild nausea. Denies emesis and anorexia. Had constipation the day prior, with normal bowel movement yesterday afternoon.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease (CAD) with history of inferior myocardial infarction (IMI), underwent drug-eluting stent (DES) placement x2, negative exercise tolerance test (ETT). Also has hypertension (HTN), irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), nocturia, and hemorrhoids.
